question: Which country invaded Iceland in 1940, as part of World War II, through "Operation Fork"?
explanation: United Kingdom invaded Iceland in 1940, as part of World War II, through "Operation Fork". The invasion of Iceland (codenamed Operation Fork) by the Royal Navy and Royal Marines occurred on 10 May 1940, during World War II. The invasion took place because the British government feared that Iceland would be used by the Germans, who had recently overrun Denmark, which was in personal union with Iceland and which had previously been largely responsible for Iceland's foreign policy.
